name: Data Drift
description: This node calculates the Population Stability Index (PSI) for a set of features by comparing a reference dataset to a test dataset. It is designed to identify potential data drift in both continuous and categorical features.
input: A reference dataset and a test dataset provided as DataFrames. The reference dataset serves as the baseline distribution, while the test dataset is used to detect any drift.
output: A Spark DataFrame with two columns: 'feature_name' and 'psi_value'. Each row represents a feature and its corresponding PSI value, indicating the level of drift.

fields.name: inputCols
fields.title: Input Columns
fields.description: A list of feature names on which the PSI will be calculated.

fields.name: categoricalCols
fields.title: Categorical Columns
fields.description: A list of features that are categorical. All other features are treated as continuous.

fields.name: numBins
fields.title: Num Bins
fields.description: The number of bins to use when binning continuous features for PSI calculation.
